$$
Z = XW + B
$$
$$
Y = f(Z)
$$


$$
\frac{\partial J}{\partial Z} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial Y} \cdot \frac{\partial Y}{\partial Z}
$$

$$
\frac{\partial J}{\partial Z} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial Y} \cdot f'(Z)
$$

$$
\frac{\partial J}{\partial W} = X^\top \cdot \frac{\partial J}{\partial Z}
$$

$$
\frac{\partial J}{\partial B} = \text{sum along rows of } \frac{\partial J}{\partial Z}
$$

$$
\frac{\partial J}{\partial X} = \frac{\partial J}{\partial Z} \cdot W^\top
$$
